title: Understanding Winter Solstice: All About Shortest Day Of The Year

title: Bill to replace MGNREGA faces criticism; TDP flags increased burden on State

title: G RAM G Bill gets LS nod: What is it - and why is opposition protesting
content: Lok Sabha passed the Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Bill, replacing MGNREGA with a 125-day wage employment guarantee for rural households. Opposition protested, calling it an attack on Gandhi's legacy and accusing the government of undermining rural development. Supporters claim it will boost villages and deter corruption.

title: Clash of egos: Is GCL making chess players talk as teams?
content: The Global Chess League is transforming the individual sport into a team setting, challenging the traditional solitary nature of chess. Players from diverse backgrounds are now sharing jerseys and coaches, fostering interaction and fun. This shift encourages communication and collaboration, proving that even in a fiercely competitive arena, greatness doesn't have to be a lonely pursuit.

title: Ghaziabad woman goes to collect rent from tenants, found dead in suitcase
content: A Ghaziabad woman was tragically found dead in a suitcase under a bed in her rented flat. She had reportedly gone to collect overdue rent from her tenants, a couple who have since been detained. The discovery was made by her domestic help after the victim failed to return home. Police are investigating the motive and cause of death.

title: ‚ÄòNo need to save money‚Äô, says Tesla CEO Musk; predicts future without poverty
content: Elon Musk foresees a future without poverty, envisioning universal high incomes where saving money becomes obsolete.  Responding to Ray Dalio's praise for a financial literacy initiative, Musk suggested technology and AI will render money irrelevant. He previously stated work will be optional within two decades, akin to a hobby, as automation advances.

title: Dec 18 throwback: When 16-year-old Sachin began his ODI journey ‚Äî and cricket found a legend
content: Thirty-six years ago today, a 16-year-old Sachin Tendulkar made his ODI debut against Pakistan, facing a formidable Waqar Younis and departing for a duck. This anti-climactic start belied a legendary career that would see him become cricket's highest ODI run-scorer. The rain-affected match saw India narrowly lose by seven runs.

title: Up to 7 yrs jail, Rs 50k fine: K'taka cracks down on hate speech; BJP raises objection
content: Karnataka Assembly passed a hate speech bill despite BJP protests. The legislation defines hate speech broadly, aiming to curb expressions causing disharmony or enmity. It includes provisions for jail terms and victim compensation. Exemptions exist for public interest and good faith acts. The government asserts it's crucial for maintaining peace and order.

title: Michaela Benthaus set to become first wheelchair user in space
content: German aerospace engineer Michaela Benthaus, a wheelchair user since 2018, is set to make history as the first person with a disability to travel to space. She will join five others on Blue Origin's 37th New Shepard mission, a suborbital flight offering a glimpse of Earth from above. This flight highlights increased accessibility in space exploration.

title: AI startup valuation model is breaking, warns Google‚Äôs top exec
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis warns that current AI startup valuations are unsustainable, with many early-stage companies raising billions before launching products. He believes this speculative funding trend, reminiscent of past bubbles, exposes flaws in the valuation model. Hassabis also emphasized pushing current AI scaling to its maximum as a critical path towards achieving artificial general intelligence (AGI).

title: TER cut: Think your mutual fund got cheaper? Read the fine print
content: SEBI's mutual fund TER changes are a transparency reset, not just a fee reduction. By unbundling costs and separating levies, SEBI aims for clearer investor understanding. Tightened brokerage caps and removed exit load charges offer potential real savings beyond the headline number.

title: With shrinking wetlands, rising climate risks, is Chennai ready for the next flood?
content: Chennai's vulnerability to floods was highlighted again as heavy rains submerged parts of the city, causing damage and disruption. Despite significant investment in stormwater drains, experts warn that encroachments on canals and rivers, along with desilting issues, continue to impede water flow, leaving the city at risk.

title: Dhurandhar box office day 14: Ranveer film slows; Avatar advance buzz
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive box office run, with its second weekend surpassing the first and becoming the biggest second weekend grosser, even beating 'Pushpa 2'. The film has now crossed Rs 674 crore worldwide, surpassing 'Baahubali's lifetime collection. Domestically, it has reached Rs 440.78 crore, though a slowdown is now evident as 'Avatar Fire And Ash' gains momentum.

title: Amazon layoffs: Biggest ever job cuts in Europe; these roles are impacted the most
content: Amazon is cutting 370 jobs, or 8.5% of its Luxembourg workforce, impacting software developers as the company embraces AI. This reduction follows a global layoff of 14,000 employees and comes after negotiations resulted in a reduced number from the initial plan. Despite the cuts, Amazon reaffirms Luxembourg as a strategic European partner.

title: Rapid weight loss, advised more rest: Yashasvi Jaiswal's health update | Exclusive
content: India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal is recovering from acute gastroenteritis after being hospitalised during Mumbai‚Äôs Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match in Pune. The left-hander suffered rapid weight loss of 2.5 kg and has been advised complete bed rest for 7‚Äì10 days. His availability for Mumbai‚Äôs early Vijay Hazare Trophy matches remains uncertain, with the BCCI medical team monitoring his recovery.

title: Shocker! 27,397 births in 3 months in a village of 1,500
content: A Yavatmal village with 1,500 residents registered an astonishing 27,397 births in three months, triggering alarm bells for a massive cyber fraud. The village's Civil Registration System ID was found mapped in Mumbai, with most registered individuals reportedly from other states. Authorities have launched a thorough investigation and are canceling the suspicious entries.

title: Portraits of US Presidents at White House: Trump adds plaques mocking Biden, Obama
content: President Trump has installed bronze plaques under presidential portraits at the White House, featuring his personal, often critical, commentary on predecessors. Many inscriptions, reportedly penned by Trump, label Joe Biden "the worst President in American History" and Barack Obama "one of the most divisive political figures," reflecting his efforts to customize the White House with his opinions.

title: Jaxson Dart‚Äôs rumored girlfriend Marissa Ayers shines as ring girl at Netflix showdown
content: Marissa Ayers has surged into the spotlight as NFL buzz and boxing spectacle collide. Linked to Giants quarterback Jaxson Dart, the Alabama alum now headlines as lead ring girl for Jake Paul‚Äôs Netflix fight against Anthony Joshua, blending quiet confidence, growing influence, and perfectly timed visibility on a massive stage.

title: India's hiring story in 2025 was less about speed, more about skills
content: India‚Äôs job market ended 2025 with strong but disciplined growth, as hiring rose 23% year-on-year before moderating in the second half, according to Foundit data. Employers prioritised productivity, leadership, and digital skills, while Tier-2 cities gained prominence. The outlook for 2026 points to steady, skills-led hiring across sectors and geographies.

title: Bondi Beach shooter‚Äôs India trail: Sajid Akram visited Hyderabad 6 times since 2001
content: Investigations into the Bondi beach attack reveal alleged shooter Sajid Akram's six visits to Hyderabad were personal, focusing on family and property. Indian authorities found no suspicious activity or overseas links during his trips. Preliminary findings suggest any radicalization of Sajid and his son Naveed occurred abroad, with Australian agencies probing further details.

title: IND vs SA: 'Stop winter cricket in North India' - Shukla sounds alarm after Lucknow T20I
content: A thick blanket of smog forced the abandonment of the India-South Africa T20I in Lucknow, prompting the BCCI to reconsider winter scheduling in North India. Vice-president Rajeev Shukla called the air pollution an "emergency," signaling a potential policy shift. Concerns over player safety and hazardous AQI levels led to the match's cancellation, with a series decider now set for Ahmedabad.

title: Squinting gestures: Row erupts over Finland MPs mocking posts; PM Petteri Orpo apologises
content: Finland's Prime Minister Petteri Orpo has apologized to Japan, China, and South Korea after several Finns Party MPs posted offensive squinting gestures on social media. The actions, intended to support a former Miss Finland, have drawn widespread condemnation and impacted international collaborations. The Prime Minister's office stressed that these actions do not represent Finland's official stance on equality and inclusion.

title: IPL auction: KKR‚Äôs mystery pick Kamra mirrors Chakravarthy, impresses Nayar - Exclusive
content: KKR‚Äôs Rs 30-lakh signing Daksh Kamra is already drawing comparisons with Varun Chakravarthy for his mystery spin and similar bowling patterns. The 22-year-old Haryana all-rounder, who clocks 95‚Äì97 km/h googlies and packs power-hitting ability, has impressed coaches and scouts, including Kumar Sangakkara and Abhishek Nayar, after a rapid rise through the under-23 ranks.

title: Ashes: 'Worst technology ever' ‚Äî Starc slams Snicko as fresh controversy erupts
content: The snickometer faced intense scrutiny during the third Ashes Test after controversial decisions involving Alex Carey and Jamie Smith.  Australian bowler Mitchell Starc branded the technology "the worst ever" after Smith was reprieved despite a visible glove movement.  Further confusion arose when Snicko later ruled Smith out, highlighting its unreliability.

title: Trump‚Äôs Gold Card finds no takers? $1 mn visa scheme sees muted interest
content: US President Trump's $1 million "Gold Card" visa program is facing a lukewarm reception in India. Wealthy Indians are reportedly shying away due to a lack of clarity on permanent residency and citizenship pathways. Instead, the established EB-5 investor visa,  remains the preferred route for aspiring Americans.

title: Jake Paul vs Tommy Fury scripted claims resurface amid Anthony Joshua allegations
content: Jake Paul is facing fight-fixing claims once again. This time, the allegations surround his December 2025 bout against Anthony Joshua. Deontay Wilder made these claims, prompting a legal threat from Paul. Previously, a leaked document suggested a fixed outcome for his fight against Tommy Fury. The promoters debunked the rumors. Both Paul and Joshua now have denied that the Joshua fight is fixed.

title: Growth over 8%! PM Modi highlights Indian economy in Muscat; set to sign India-Oman FTA
content: Prime Minister Modi highlighted the historical depth of India-Oman trade ties at the India-Oman Business Forum, emphasizing deeper economic collaboration ahead of a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA). The CEPA aims to boost bilateral trade beyond $10 billion by offering duty-free trade and removing barriers, positioning Oman as a strategic gateway for Indian businesses.

title: Delhi 50% WFH: Why it may be easier said than done
content: Delhi's 50% work-from-home directive under GRAP has caused confusion among office-goers, with many unaware or unsure of its implementation. While some firms are adapting, smaller businesses cite manpower and resource limitations, leaving the actual impact and enforcement uncertain.

title: Goa nightclub fire probe: Cops term Luthras flight risk; Mapusa court turns down duo‚Äôs demand for mattress
content: Owners of Birch by Romeo Lane, where 25 died in a fire, were remanded in five-day police custody. Goa police sought custody to uncover financial transactions, prevent further illegal operations, and identify associates. The Luthra brothers had fled India after the incident but were arrested upon their return.

title: IND vs SA: 'No cricket...AQI 411' - Tharoor‚Äôs stinging post after Lucknow T20I is lost to smog
content: The fourth T20I between India and South Africa in Lucknow was abandoned without a ball bowled due to persistent fog and poor air quality. Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor criticized the venue selection, highlighting the hazardous AQI and suggesting Thiruvananthapuram as a better alternative. Player welfare concerns were amplified as Hardik Pandya was seen wearing a mask during warm-ups.

title: UP board exams 2026: UPMSP releases list of exam centres; check direct link to city-wise allotment
content: UP Board has unveiled exam centre lists for 2026 High School and Intermediate exams on upmsp.edu.in. Students can raise objections until December 22, 2025. The board has designated 7,448 centres statewide. Theory exams are set from February 18 to March 12, 2026, with practicals in January. Hall tickets are expected by late January or early February.

title: Betting on iPhones! Tatas invest Rs 1,500 crore in Tata Electronics
content: Tata Group is significantly boosting its investment in iPhone manufacturing, injecting an additional Rs 1,500 crore into Tata Electronics, a key Apple supplier. This move aims to expand capacity for iPhones, with a substantial portion exported. The company is also venturing into semiconductor production.

title: 'Worst is behind us': IndiGo CEO urges staff to avoid speculation as flights stabilise - video
content: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers assured employees that the airline's operational disruptions are largely resolved, with the "worst behind us." He highlighted the restoration of 2,200 flights and outlined priorities: resilience, root cause analysis, and rebuilding. Elbers urged staff to avoid speculation, emphasizing a comprehensive investigation into the recent challenges.

title: ‚ÄòThis is how we did it‚Äô: China embassy has advice for Delhi pollution
content: China's Beijing has significantly improved its air quality by implementing stringent vehicle emission controls, phasing out old vehicles, and promoting electric mobility. The nation also undertook industrial restructuring, relocating heavy industries and transforming former factory sites. These comprehensive, large-scale, and urgent measures offer valuable lessons for India's approach to tackling air pollution.

title: 'Behaving worse than hyenas': Actor Nidhhi Agerwal mobbed at Hyderabad mall
content: Actor Nidhhi Agerwal experienced a distressing situation at a song launch event in Hyderabad, where an unruly crowd pressed in on her. Security had to intervene to escort her to her vehicle amidst the chaos. The incident has ignited discussions on celebrity safety and crowd control, with singer Chinmayi Sripada condemning the behavior as harassment.

title: What happened to Riziki Ilenre? Police investigate TikTok star‚Äôs death after fan claims
content: Police are investigating the death of TikTok creator Riziki Ilenre after her passing sparked widespread concern online. Fans have raised troubling claims involving bullying and possible suicide, though authorities have not confirmed a cause of death. As the case remains open, supporters continue to mourn Ilenre while calling for compassion and mental health awareness.

title: Economic boom for US? Trump's promises for 2026 ‚Äî lower interests, cheap electricity & more
content: President Trump anticipates a significant economic boom next year, citing his administration's policies. He promised increased take-home pay, the impact of major tax cuts, and a surge in electricity production leading to lower prices.  Furthermore, he plans to announce a Federal Reserve chair favoring lower interest rates and aggressive housing reforms, asserting America's renewed global respect and economic strength.

title: No fuel without PUC, old cars barred, WFH: What you must know before taking out your car in Delhi
content: Delhi has implemented stringent anti-pollution measures under GRAP-IV, including a ban on non-BS VI vehicles from outside the city and denial of fuel to vehicles without valid pollution certificates. Offices are mandated to have 50% staff work from home. These actions aim to combat severe air quality expected to persist until December 27.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Gold, silver to touch new highs? Here's the outlook
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold prices are surging to new peaks, maintaining a strong bullish trend with higher highs and lows. Silver also shows significant positive momentum, breaking out of consolidation. Experts anticipate further gains for both precious metals.

title: Peace prize to Machado: Why is WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange suing Nobel panel?
content: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has filed a criminal complaint in Sweden against senior Nobel Foundation figures, accusing them of economic crimes and facilitating war crimes. The complaint targets the award of the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize to Mar√≠a Corina Machado, alleging the disbursement of funds contradicts Alfred Nobel's will and could aid aggression.

title: Flying spy? Seagull with made-in-China GPS tracker found on Karnataka beach
content: A GPS-tagged seagull on Karwar beach, initially causing local concern, was revealed to be part of a scientific study by the Wildlife and Nature Protection Society of Sri Lanka. Forest officials confirmed the device was for tracking migration patterns, not surveillance, after the exhausted bird was rescued.

title: Exclusive: 'Ghar wapsi hai meri' - Bishnoi looking to form deadly combo with Jadeja at RR
content: India spinner Ravi Bishnoi expressed immense joy after being bought by Rajasthan Royals for Rs 7.2 crore in the IPL mini-auction, calling it a 'ghar wapsi' (homecoming). He is eager to play in front of his home crowd and contribute to the team's success, aiming to create good memories with wickets and wins.

title: Why Flagg is in LeBron and Kobe territory, Carrington a sneaky pickup
content: Nikola Jokic posted 39 points, 15 rebounds and 10 assists in overtime win against Houston . alperen Sengun matched the moment with a 33-point triple-double . Cade Cunningham becomes the youngest player to score at least 40 in a game .

title: How Wallstedt, Bussi and five other NHL goalies leveled up their play this season
content: jesper wallstedt is a Minnesota Wild goaltender who's rewriting the franchise's rookie record books . he's at the top of a goaltending wave bringing new freshmen to light in the season's first half . it's almost a mystery how these things work .

title: Survivor pool strategy: Bills, Texans among top options in Week 16
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the most fun games to play this NFL season . the Texans are being picked in over half of remaining entries early in the week . they are available for 58% of Eliminators Challenge entries .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Quinn Henicle lifts Old Dominion to 10 wins
content: the 2025 bowl season is ramping up and college football experts are here to highlight the best performances from bowl season . we'll pick MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . RB Jo Silver's 61-yard run opened the scoring, and he finished with 116 yards on 14 carries .

title: UWCL grades for all 18 teams: Leuven get A+; Bar√ßa an A-, PSG fail
content: "Futbol Women's" crew debate which team can make a deep run in the UEFA women's champions league . OH LEUVEN (A+) they might have only finished 12th, but sealing a spot in the knockout-phase playoffs would have been beyond the minnows' wildest dreams . three tight wins from their first three games set up them for success .

title: Ward wants Titans to involve him in HC search
content: quarterback says he'll be all-in on the next head coach regardless of whether it's a defensive- or offensive-minded hire . Tennessee fired coach Brian Callahan in October after a 1-5 start to the season .

title: 7 years on, OBC list still to get Parliament's stamp
content: the central list of backwards has not been notified for the last seven years . it was granted constitutional status to the national commission for backward classes . govt sources said the list has to be notified by parliament in view of the 102nd constitutional amendment of 2018 .

title: ‚ÄòWhat if orders are palpably dishonest?‚Äô SC says growing trend of judges ‚Äòhitting sixes‚Äô before retiring
content: 'what if Orders Are Palpably Dishonest?' a bench led by CJI Surya Kant said there is a growing trend of judges passing orders for extraneous considerations on the eve of their retirements . a petition filed by a principal district judge challenging his suspension 10 days prior to retirement allegedly because of two judicial orders passed by him .

title: Team races against time to save a tangled sea lion in British Columbia
content: a team of marine mammal experts spent several days searching for a sea lion . the tangled animal had been spotted on a dock leading into the bay in southwestern canada . without help, the 330-pound sealion would die . a dart gun was loaded and a sedative was shot .

title: 150 prospects, 12 schools, 7 rounds: We stacked players in the CFP by NFL draft stock
content: the top 12 teams of the 2025 CFB season have plenty of prospects for the 2026 draft . we're identifying each player in the playoff who could be selected in the upcoming draft and which round they'd fit best right now . this is where things stand right now and a good picture of which teams could be sending a bunch of top talent to the early rounds .
